MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's fine just sitting in here and observing, but this observation hut—or should I say tent—is so cramped! I wish it was bigger.
Oculus seemed to have finally arrived at an answer. She was able to do a good job because she stayed true to who she was. She doesn't need to force herself to change.
I just won't tell her that I was interested in seeing what a calmer Oculus was like...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: How was that? I think I got out all the stress I've been feeling for the past three days! Oh, Conductor, did you say something about staying here?

I heard a roar and looked back,
and saw that the incredible attack magic that Oculus had unleashed had wiped out all the mist monsters.
Now that we've identified the source, I'll go back and organize a team to take out the mist monsters. Oculus, stay here and keep an eye on—

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Thanks! I knew you'd understand!
Don't worry about it. It's thanks to your on-the-fly judgment that we were able to find the source. I should be complimenting you, not scolding you for violating my orders.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: And just as the wind was changing, the mist appeared, right? I know that I was supposed to sit tight and observe, but I couldn't miss this chance.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I told you I was watching the animals. I noticed that they were changing their behavior according to the wind. The wind carries smells that they can pick up on.

If Oculus' hypothesis is correct, the path of the phantom mist and its origin could not be identified due to the changing wind direction. However, she was able to locate the source. How could she have known where to look?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: We've found the source.
Oculus continued to inch forward, looking to see what was ahead. Then we came upon a sheer cliff. Mist was spewing out of the cracks in the wall, and we could see several mist monsters near it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Keep quiet.
It looks like the phantom mist is here.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Haven't you noticed? There are times when the wind changes direction several times in a short period around here. I think it's because of the mountains and valleys over there. That's what's happening right now.
Right now, we are deep in the woods of Verforet. We've received reports of repeated phantom mist occurrences in this area, and we're here to investigate.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'm sorry for rushing off, but the wind will change before long.
Oculus finally came to a stop and spoke.

I hurriedly chased after Oculus, who was running toward the depths of the forest where the phantom mist was coming from. As we made our way through the forest, the mist gradually became thicker. Does this mean we're getting closer to the source?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Follow me!
When I looked at my pocket watch to check the time, Oculus, who had been staring deep into the forest, quickly turned around and ran out of the tent. What's happened?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's fun to watch all the different animals go by,
but I'm getting tired of looking at them.

Yes, despite three days of extensive investigations, we have not been able to find the source of the phantom mist. The way it is generated is irregular and unlike what we have seen before. The first thing we must do is figure out the pattern to the mist's appearance.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Then I don't need to switch out. I'm also a train knight. I can't make it easy for myself when everyone else is working so hard.
So far, we haven't needed to arrange a replacement.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: What is everyone else doing?

If it's that hard, maybe we should arrange for someone to replace you?
And you're allowed to go out for a bit, you know?
The wind will change?
Ah, no. I guess I was a little too late...
Oculus muttered quietly.
I stood next to Oculus and looked deep into the forest. I could see that she was right—there is a faint mist rolling in. We need to find out where that mist is coming from and where it's going.

Even while we were chatting away, Oculus kept her eyes on the depths of the forest. It's a big step up from the entrance ceremony of the Knight Academy, when she ran off because she couldn't stand the length of the principal's speech.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Huh? Who told you that? I didn't run off. I just asked the principal if his boring speech was going to continue for much longer. I only asked!
Upon saying that, Oculus held up her index finger to her lips.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Don't be so mean!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh no, I did it again. I don't know if it's because I can't control myself,
but I realize I've gotta change. I'm aware of what I'm doing, but...

Don't worry about it. It turned out for the best. The mist monsters and the crack in the wall from which the mist originated are no longer even visible. The mist still drifting through the air will soon disappear.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Really? Alright then! It's a shame I couldn't be a good, calm girl,
but I guess I'll just have to be myself.
What kind of logic is that?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
*Sigh* I want to run around until I'm exhausted.
I want to sing loudly and dance and make a lot of noise.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Is there really any mist around here?
We've been investigating this place for three days now and we haven't seen anything.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Conductor, what time is it?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Really? So, you do think I'm good?
Hearing that alone is enough to keep me sitting here doing nothing for a whole year!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
No, we are.
If you start to think of me as a good girl, that means I win.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Really? So, if I complete this mission,
will you think of me as a good, calm girl?
I see. This is more of a field exercise than a training exercise for you, but I'm glad to see you're trying your best.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It was a joke! Seriously, if I think of being in this place as a training exercise to help me achieve a sense of inner peace, I think I can manage it.

There are no tents like that in the world.
And by two generations, do you mean you're going to invite your parents from the countryside?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmmm, big enough for two generations to fit in, so eight bedrooms and a pool?
By the way, just for reference, how much bigger would it need to be to satisfy you?

We'll need to be on the move depending on the progress of the investigation, and we can't afford to set up a fancy camp and be noticed by the mist monsters. That's why we've set up something that we can carry with us.
A good girl? I don't know if we're really on the same page here...

That's not what this is about.
I'm not saying I don't see you as a good girl.
